title: Socialist Party (France) - Wikipedia
snippet: The PS is a member of the Party of European Socialists, Progressive Alliance and Socialist International. The PS was founded in 1969 from a merger of the French Section of the Workers' International (SFIO), the Convention of Republican Institutions led by François Mitterrand, and other groups.

title: Socialist Party (PS) | Britannica
snippet: Its predecessor parties, formed in the 19th century, drew inspiration from political and social theorists such as Charles Fourier, Henri de Saint-Simon, François-Noël Babeuf, Auguste Blanqui, and Louis Blanc.

title: Socialist Party, France - Oxford Reference
snippet: Early history (up to 1969)Formed in 1905, the SFIO (Section Française de l'Internationale Ouvrière, French Section of the Socialist International) united the hitherto fragmented socialist groups. These included the Marxists under J. Guesde, the revolutionary socialists, and the pragmatic ...

title: French Socialist Party (1902) - Wikipedia
snippet: The PSF came from the merger of the possibilist Federation of the Socialist Workers of France (FTSF), Jean Allemane's Revolutionary Socialist Workers' Party (POSR), and some independent socialist politicians like Jean Jaurès, who went on to become the party's leader.
